thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Wednesday, 24 Jan 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Strong demand for Amber

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Strong demand for Amber
text: HONG KONG, Jan 25 (IFR) - The Rs6bn (US$94m) IPO of Amber Enterprises has drawn strong demand, having been 165 times covered. The high-net-worth tranche was 519 times covered, while the institutional portion was 175 times subscribed. The IPO, which comprises primary shares of Rs4.75bn and secondary shares of Rs1.25bn, was marketed at a price range of Rs855â€“Rs859 each. For the financial year to March 31 2017, Amber reported a net profit of Rs279m on revenue of Rs16.5bn. The company manufactures air-conditioners for consumer goods companies like Daikin, Hitachi, LG, Panasonic, Voltas and Godrej. BNP Paribas, Edelweiss, IDFC and SBI Capital were bookrunners. (Reporting by Fiona Lau)
